The code for the flags can be found here: <a href="https://github.com/dillonwu-97/csec-code/blob/main/cryptohacks/general/general.py"> https://github.com/dillonwu-97/csec-code/blob/main/cryptohacks/general/general.py </a>

### <ins> Encoding </ins>
The flags are:
1. crypto{ASCII\_pr1nt4bl3}
2. crypto{You\_will\_be\_working\_with\_hex\_strings\_a\_lot}
3. crypto/Base+64+Encoding+is+Web+Safe/
4. crypto{3nc0d1n6\_4ll\_7h3\_w4y\_d0wn}
5. crypto{3nc0d3\_d3c0d3\_3nc0d3}


### <ins> XOR </ins>
The flags are:
1. crypto{aloha}
2. crypto{x0r\_i5\_ass0c1at1v3}
3. crypto{0x10\_15\_my\_f4v0ur173\_by7e}
4. crypto{1f\_y0u\_Kn0w\_En0uGH\_y0u\_Kn0w\_1t\_4ll}
5. crypto{X0Rly\_n0t!}

### <ins> Math </ins>
1. 1512
2. crypto{10245,-8404}
3. 4
4. 1
5. 9

### <ins> Data Formats </ins>
1. 
2. 
3. 
4. crypto{thx\_redpwn\_for\_inspiration}
For this problem, I used the tool Sublist3r, which can be found here: https://github.com/aboul3la/Sublist3r
